greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) (n>=1, 1<=k<=n) read by rows, giving number of Piet Hut's "coat-hanger" arrangements: unlabeled forests of rooted trees with n edges and k connected components, in which the outdegree of each node is <= 2 and the symmetric group acts on the components.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
formula: G.f.: exp(sum_{k=1..infinity) z^k*B(x^k)/k ), where B(x) = x + x^2 + 2*x^3 + 3*x^4 + 6*x^5 + 11*x^6 + ... = G001190(x)/x - 1 and G001190 is the g.f. for the Wedderburn-Etherington numbers A001190.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(p>n, 0, `if`(n=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 11 2017
mathematica: g[n_] := g[n] = If[n<2, n, If[OddQ[n], 0, Function[t, t*(1-t)/2][g[n/2]]] + Sum[g[i]*g[n - i], {i, 1, n/2}]];
b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = If[p>n, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[Min[i, p]<1, 0, Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1, p-j]*Binomial[g[i+1]+j-1, j], {j, 0, Min[n/i, p]}]]]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 14}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 11 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: First 3 columns are A001190, A036657, A036658.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 06 2003
